title: ICE when using associated constant in type

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
### Code ```Rust struct X(P,Q); struct L(T); impl L{ const S: usize=1; } impl X::S]>{ } ``` ### Meta Tested on Playground. Affects both stable and nightly. ### Error output ``` Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground) error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_middle/ty/subst.rs:554:17: type parameter `T/#0` (T/0) out of range when substituting (root type=Some(T)) substs=[] ```
Backtrace

``` thhread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/3503f565e1fb7296983757d2716346f48a4a262b/src/libstd/macros.rs:13:23 stack backtrace: 0: backtrace::backtrace::libunwind::trace at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.46/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:86 1: backtrace::backtrace::trace_unsynchronized at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:59 4: core::fmt::write at src/libcore/fmt/mod.rs:1076 5: std::io::Write::write_fmt at src/libstd/io/mod.rs:1537 6: std::sys_common::backtrace::_print at 2020-07-02) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are const-evaluating + checking `X::::{{constant}}#0` #3 [check_item_well_formed] checking that `X` is well-formed #4 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack ```
